document.title: SSA-234763: OpenSSL Vulnerabilities inSiemens Industrial Products

notes.title: Summary
notes.text:
Vulnerabilities in OpenSSL (see https://www.openssl.org/news/secadv_20140605.txt) affect several
Siemens industrial products. Siemens has released updates for all affected products.

notes.title: Workarounds
notes.text: Siemens has not identiﬁed any speciﬁc mitigations or workarounds.

notes.title: General Recommendations
notes.text:
As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices
with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens
recommends to conﬁgure the environment according to Siemens’ operational guidelines for Industrial
Security (Download: https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security), and to
follow the recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/
industrialsecurity

notes.title: Additional Information
notes.text:
For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the
Siemens ProductCERT:
https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories

references.summary: SSA-234763: OpenSSL Vulnerabilities inSiemens Industrial Products - PDF Version

acknowledgments.organization: Siemens thanks the following parties for their efforts:
Artem Zinenko from Kaspersky for pointing out that SIPLUS should also be mentioned

notes.title: Summary
notes.text:
An attacker could perform a man-in-the-middle (MITM) attack between a vulnerable client and a
vulnerable server. This vulnerability affects ROX, APE, S7-1500 and CP1543-1.

notes.title: Summary
notes.text:
Specially crafted packets may crash the web server of the PLC. This vulnerability affects the SIMATIC
S7-1500.
